name: Hill House Bed & Breakfast Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hill House was amazing! The staff was very accommodating! This was our first time to stay at a BB and it was great- never want to stay at hotel again. We loved it here. We will def be back :)
reviews.title: Honeymoon
Good location, lovely garden
reviews.text: Hill House B&B is within walking distance of downtown Asheville, has extensive and lovely gardens, and benefits from a special assistant, Matthew. Our particular room, on the ground floor, had a nice view of the garden but was too dimly lit to read in at night because we are elderly and need more light. Most of you would probably not notice this. Matthew is a real gem, willing to answer any question and help in any way he can. He was a huge help in telling us what to order at his favorite downtown restaurant, Curate (highly recommended). Despite our travels to several European countries, including Spain, we were not very familiar with tapas (missed that lesson in Barcelona), and he patiently marked our menu and told us a lot about his travels in Spain, his relatives who still live there, and his background in the tapas restaurant business. We took so much of his time (30 minutes?) that his job was neglected, for which we must apologize. He has such good manners that we could not have guessed we were taking him away from more important work. One suggestion for improvement would be to provide an ice machine in the guest kitchen so guests don't have to bother the owner or Matthew for ice. The warm weather, coupled with warm club soda stored in our room, caused the ice to melt at a rapid rate and required us to pester the owner for more ice. Other guests were having a problem finding ample ice as well - maybe just one day and not a normal occurrence. Also, a reading lamp in the room with a higher wattage bulb would be desirable. There is a breakfast cook who evidently also helps with tidying up the rooms; she is extremely energetic and moves so fast we didn't really get to say hello, but several guests were pleased with her breakfast offerings - she alternates sweet and savory, so if you stay two days you can try both. We can recommend Blue Spiral 1 gallery and the Co-op gallery downtown, in addition to Curate.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I have been in BB in many countries, in particular in France, but this has been one of the best. Great keepers, clean, nicely decorated and comfortable room (we loved the shabby shic deco). We especially enjoyed the hang mat, the porch and the hospitality of David & Matthew, we had a great time!
reviews.title: Great and quiete place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was a last minute decision to visit Asheville after being in Atlanta visiting our grandkids. I found Hill House B&B on the internet and was able to book a room for the weekend. Our room had a beautiful view of the garden which has a hammock and wooden chairs for relaxing. The house is surrounded by beautiful trees and plants and provides privacy. Our host Matthew and the young man working the evening we arrived were very welcoming and gave us suggestions for dining in Asheville. The room was clean and the bed comfortable with plenty of pillows. There were pastries/coffee available at 7:00 and a formal breakfast at 9:00.The breakfast on Saturday morning was delicious; gourmet pancakes, mango/orange juice and plenty of coffee. It was a cool morning and all the guests had breakfast on the porch. We enjoyed talking to everyone and were given great ideas of things to do around Asheville. My husband and I have been to many B&B's over the years and this is one we would love to stay in again.
reviews.title: Destress Here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After seeing the rates at the Grove Park Inn and the Inn at Biltmore I switched gears and started looking for B&Bs...Based on amenities and TripAdvisor reviews we selected the Hill House and couldn't have been more pleased! We chose the Flat Iron Suite and were pleasantly surprised with the size of the room and sitting area - it was perfect for relaxing during the day and peaceful slumber at night. The breakfasts were delicious and the Bottomless Cookie Jar, treat of the day and fresh lemonade were especially thoughtful - perfect for a quick snack before a great dinner downtown. We'll definitely be back!
reviews.title: A Perfect Trip to Asheville

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here after pouring over all the other options on the net and AAA tour books and couldn't have been more pleased. Bill and Terry were excellent hosts; friendly, always available but never "hovering," as we've experienced elsewhere. The neighborhood seemed safe enough and the rooms, gardens, and front porch were great. We'd go back there again in a heartbeat.
reviews.title: Fantastic B&B

likes.liked: — Delightful breakfasts on the front porch

reviews.text: Best bed and breakfast we have stayed at yet. Wonderful full breakfast served on the large outdoor patio, overlooking the beautiful garden. Coffe and fresh pasties available before breakfast. Evening snack, tea or wine available - cookies are yummy!!
reviews.title: Wow

reviews.title: Look no further for relaxation!
life's delights
reviews.text: to keep to ourselves. Bill and Terry were very welcoming and friendly. Very clean and relaxing. Spent 2 nights in the S & W room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Two friends and I stayed at Hill House in mid-June for 3 nights. It was a lovely experience. The setting is beautiful, in a very nice neighborhood and a pleasant walk to downtown Asheville. In fact, we found Hill House's location to be a major asset, as parking can be a problem in the town center, especially on weekend nights. We enjoyed the English-style garden while we breakfasted on the porch. Breakfast was a real treat! Each morning Matthew whipped up a special quiche or other delightful dish, which was beautifully presented.The rooms are inviting and comfortable -- we stayed in the Flat Iron Suite -- and very quiet. Next time we visit Asheville, we will certainly return to Hill House B&B.
reviews.title: Comfort and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I definitely recommend staying in the Biltmore Suite. We had a wonderful view and it was so relaxing after a day of sight seeing. The breakfast on the front porch is delicious. Definitely take the time to relax in the hammock at some point!
reviews.title: Wonderful Asheville B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Hill House is well-located and extremely comfortable. It has a pleasant semi-casual vibe, with a huge front porch overlooking a very lovely yard. Sipping a complimentary glass of wine on that porch was a welcome end to a busy day. I didn't find the time to relax in the hammock, so am saving that treat for my next visit. We enjoyed meeting David, Crystal and Matthew. They took extra care to make sure our individual needs were met, including adapting breakfast recipes for vegetarians and for those who can't eat eggs. Much appreciated! A special shout-out to Matthew for greeting us so kindly and not rushing us to our room.The Battery Park Room is perfect for two friends traveling together who want separate beds. I was happy on the sleeping porch, in a truly comfortable daybed, with all windows wide open. I wish the shower was larger and newer, but it suited our needs overall. I guess we were lucky -- the other guests were friendly and chatty in a good way, so breakfast was a fun event, not an uncomfortable one. And did I mention that the breakfast entree was filling & delicious with just the right touch of elegance?
reviews.title: Divine breakfasts, wonderful front porch, friendly/helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I visited Asheville in mid-June and we stayed in the Biltmore Suite. My sister and her boyfriend traveled from their home and stayed in the Flat Iron Suite. Both rooms were great and very comfortable. Each morning breakfast was served on the porch, and the four of us were lucky enough to be joined at our table all four mornings by a newlywed couple. That was part of the fun in staying at Hill House - we met some of the other travelers who shared stories and tips. Breakfast was terrific each morning, there was always fresh chocolate chip cookies for a snack, and we would sometimes sit on the porch in the evening and watch the fireflies (lightning bugs, as some folks call them).
reviews.title: Great hospitality and comfort!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is within walking distance to a park and a few restaurants, and a short drive to downtown. Depending on the guests' interest, a yoga instructor is available, and she conducted a session (at 7:30) for two mornings during our stay, which was quite popular and a nice way to start the day. My wife and sister also got a discount at a downtown spa when mentioning that they were staying at Hill House.
reviews.title: Delightful B & B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved the Hill House B&B. We spent 4 nights there and wished we had spent more. Terry and BIll should be giving lessons to other B&B's. Their attention to detail and their guests comfort was amazing...glass of wine in the evenings on their beautiful porch, incredible breakfasts every day, ice tea or lemonade always readily available, cookies or some tasty treat every afternoon, always willing to assist, beautiful rooms that were comfortable, easy parking, etc. We left there to stay at another B&B in Brevard, NC and were disappointed after such a wonderful stay at the Hill House.
reviews.title: Best B&B Ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I took my husband to Asheville for an extended birthday weekend and booked our accommodations with Hill House. We stayed in the S&W room, and were very impressed with the Inn.
reviews.title: Would stay there again in a heartbeat....

likes.liked: — It was cozy & comfy just like home- cute amenities like bottomless cookie jar, brownies, etc.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights, 4 days and each breakfast was delicious....the house was quiet, people enjoyable, the hosts were gracious and always available to answer our questions. I can't wait to go back!
reviews.title: Relax...

reviews.text: Thanks Bill & Terry!
reviews.title: Hill House- heaven!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent our honeymoon in Asheville at the Hill House and it was a wonderful experience. Bill and Terry are fabulous innkeepers - the house was immaculate, the food delicious, and the grounds are spectacular. We stayed in the Biltmore room which faces downtown Asheville and has windows on three sides of the house. The room is beautiful, comfortable, and very private. The bathroom is large and elegant with a great jacuzzi tub, but it lacks a shower other than a pull-out spray nozzle in the tub; this was the only slight inconvenience that we experienced, otherwise everything was great. The location is convenient to almost everything in the area, and the house is in a nice neighborhood without heavy traffic. We have stayed in several B&B's in Asheville and this is among the best.
reviews.title: A Top Quality B&B

likes.liked: — The front porch and the historic character of the house

reviews.title: A lovely inn.
reviews.text: We loved our stay at the Hill House. The owners are gracious and seemed to always appear when we had a question or needed something. The breakfasts (we had three) were delicious and presented in an unhurried manner. The room we stayed in was plenty big, very clean, and comfortable. We felt plenty pampered, but also as if we were staying in our own home. The common areas (parlor, porches) are comfortable and inviting and the side yard with a hammock and Adirondack chairs is a perfect place to unwind. We recommend it highly.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007
reviews.text: I wish I could be as gracious as the majority of reviewers here,however I have to be honest. The experience at this Inn left me feeling underwhelmed! The gardens, and food were excellent.The hospitality was less than warm and cozy.Ashely who checked me in neglected to introduce herself and toured me thru the property as if in a hypnotic state, Bill seemed less than thrilled to meet and greet however Terri was friendly/courteous enough. The room I had was adequate however needed some cosmetic attention to paint and there was an artifical ficus tree with silk leaves that has not been dusted in years.Will not return or recommend.
reviews.title: Underwhelmed
Wonderful stay!
reviews.text: The best thing is the proximity to downtown Asheville and the wonderful variety of Restaurants....Musts are Limones,Bouchon,Ophelias.

reviews.title: Fabulous on all accounts
reviews.text: Hill House was a fabulous place to stay. Their service is top notch. It was the best B&B my husband and I have ever stayed at because they go the extra mile. Comfortable and beautiful rooms, cookies and beverages available at all times, and fresh home-cooked breakfast every morning. Also a beautiful garden to relax in. It was the perfect place to stay! We continued our travels to another city after staying in Ashville and felt let down by the other places we stayed. It was a fabulous place to stay to start off our honeymoon!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I chose the Hill House B&B on our way to Asheville...while in the car! It was an adventure from the beginning and Hill House gave us a place like home. :) We stayed in the cottage and it was wonderful! We had all the comforts of home plus wonderful breakfasts (I wish I had bought a recipe book!) at the main house each morning. The staff was informative, helpful, courteous and fantastic! It was a great touch to leave us cookies in the Cottage's private kitchen area.
reviews.title: Lovely, Romantic Weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A beautiful old house near downtown Asheville, NC with a friendly helpful owner and staff. The breakfasts were great on the large porch overlooking the front garden. We loved it and recommend it to anyone. Probably not as good for kids, however.
reviews.title: Wonderful B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a very enjoyable experience. David and Matthew were very hospitible and made us feel welcome from the time we arrived until the time we checked out. The location is a perfect walk to downtown Asheville which allowed us the ability to participate in the activities of downtown and at the same time enjoy the peace and tranquility of sitting on the front porch with a glass of wine. The room was gorgeous and we enjoyed a very quiet and peaceful night's sleep to awake to the aroma of freshly brewed coffee and rocking chairs on the front porch where we could savor in breathing the fresh morning mountain air. Breakfast was served on the porch after an appetizer of fresh sconces and interesting conversations with guests from other parts of the country. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and can only look forward to returning for an encore performance!
reviews.title: Dream Birthday Weekend in Asheville

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed twice before at the Hill House. It was owned by another couple at the time. The new owners took over about 6 months before our latest trip and they are working hard to keep up the igh standards the original owners held. The rooms are unchanged and are still quite nice with little touches that make the place special. The breakfasts were very good and there were "munchies" available at other times of day.
reviews.title: A Stay at the Hill House Under New Ownership

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If there's any place where things need a bit more attention it is in the garden. The previous owners paid great attention to it and it was quite beautiful whenever we visited. The new folks seem not to notice certain weedy things like dandelions and other invasives that have begun to make their presences known. They have also erected a badminton net that is a bit intrusive in the garden. Perhaps putting it up on request and then taking it down when no one needs it would be a good idea. In fact, we never saw anyone use it so perhaps its prominence in the garden is a bit out of scale to its utility.
reviews.title: Cozy and clean, friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I recently stayed at Hill House B & B and loved it. While my husband read the newspaper and drank very good coffee on the front porch, I took yoga in the gardens. Then we had a delicious breakfast on the front porch and had a wonderful talking to the other guests. Our room was nicely appointed and clean and comfortable. They had drinks and a cookie jar full of cookies in the common area kitchen every day. I would definitely recommend this B & B to someone going to Asheville, NC.
reviews.title: Relaxing and elegant B & B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Hill House for a few days in early July to check out Asheville. This was my first time in a Bed and Breakfast and it was a great experience! Matthew was very helpful with places to see and where to eat in Asheville. Both David and Matthew were very welcoming and kind. Although I didn't get to talk to Crystal, she made a great breakfast one morning! The Hill House is close enough to downtown Asheville that you could easily walk or ride a bike downtown. I would definitely stay again next time I'm in Asheville!
reviews.title: Great Experience at the Hill House!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: My wife and I really enjoyed our stay at Hill House. Breakfast here was amazing. Thanks Matthew and the rest of the staff. We stayed in the Kress room. Really enojoyed the decor and antiques all around. The claw tub was so cool! The house is very relaxing and also has tons of interesting decor and antiques to enjoy. I did the Yoga in the mornings both day's and very much enjoyed this as well. Great start to each day. We would highly recommend staying at Hill house when they visit Asheville!
reviews.title: Great place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Hill House for our honeymoon. We arrived later in the day and were promptly greeted by Matthew's friendly face and welcome; and the next morning were introduced to David and Crystal who were also warm and welcoming. The old-world, Victorian feel of Hill House is welcoming, relaxing, and comforting, a perfect match to its keepers. Throughout our stay David, Matthew, and Crystal were helpful with advice on where to go and what to see and where to eat. At the end of a day of walking around the Biltmore House and downtown Asheville, Hill House was the perfect oasis for us to unwind and rest. We HIGHLY recommend Hill House B&B and plan to return soon!!
reviews.title: Perfect for ANY Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hill House is beautifully maintained and very comfortable. Good parking, great location close to downtown. The rooms have every comfort you might need. Enjoyed delicious breakfasts on the front porch!
reviews.title: Lovely B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Biltmore Suite for two nights during Valentine's Day Week and it was a wonderful trip. The Suite was beautifully decorated and very comfortable - the couch and fireplace, very cozy.
reviews.title: Great Attention to Detail

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Both nights we were at the Hill House, there was only one other couple at the Bed & Breakfast so it was relatively deserted. Notwithstanding the lack of guests, there were always drinks and snacks in the guest kitchen. The breakfast each morning was delicious and sophisticated.
reviews.title: Nice place, but owners could relax a bit....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled solo
reviews.text: We were interested in a quiet, romantic trip and definitely got it.
reviews.title: Wonderful!

likes.disliked: — A tip on tipping - The B&B leaves an envelope in the room to assist you in leaving a tip for the cleaning staff. They suggest $5 per day. They do a great job - don't be as forgetful as me and not have any cash on hand!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed there over New Year's 2006/2007. The property is very nice. Clean, plenty of parking, well located. We enjoyed the company at breakfast and of course, Bailey.
reviews.title: Perfect B & B experience at Hill House

likes.liked: — Everything was thoughtfully taken care of.
likes.disliked: — The S & W room is right next to the dining room, so not quite perfectly private.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were only disappointed in the innkeepers. They seemed very tense. Understandably, running a B&B is not an easy job, but it seemed as if they were too concerned about just getting the job done. We have stayed at numerous B&B's and truly enjoy the interaction with innkeepers, and their knowledge of the local area, etc. That didn't happen here. I guess we were expecting a bit more "southern hospitality".
reviews.title: Fun B&B, Wonderful Hosts

likes.disliked: — The room was a little smaller than we usually like to have.

description: Hill House Bed & Breakfast Inn lies in the heart of Asheville, NC, just minutes to downtown and Biltmore Estate. Enjoy those extra special touches, from exceptionally restful beds and delightful breakfasts to our expansive wrap-around porch overlooking the gardens. You'll feel comfortably at home in the casual elegance of this 1885 residence with an eclectic mix of antique, traditional and unusual furnishings. Choose from nine guest accommodations, most with fireplaces and/or whirlpool tubs.
